result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Keaton J Lyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.
May apply for expungement at age 21 if he successfully completes probation and the diversion agreement on count 3.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent. 

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first 6 months of probation, at agent's direction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keaton J Lyon

defendant.name: Lyon, Keaton J
defendant.address: 610 W. Burnett St., Beaver Dam, WI 53916

records.addlTxt: I sent a note to the Judge regarding expunction - I can't close an open case.

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appears in person without counsel.  Defendant has filed a petition to expunge.  There is a discharge certificate on file indicating he succesfully completed probation, all financial obligations are paid, and he has no new criminal conviction. State does not object.  

Court finds he completed his sentence;all obligations; and grants expungment.  Court will generate the Order and a copy will be mailed to defendant.

Notes:  Judge talked to me out of court.  She said it can just be expunged without an order because he completed his sentence/probation.
Hearing on October 15, 2018 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant appears in person without counsel.  District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Court notifies the defendant that he is filling in today and he is not able to address expungment.  It will need to be rescheduled with J.A.

records.addlTxt: Notice of case status change
Mailed a copy of the hand written order to the probation agent. JMM
from DOC.  Sent to Judge Becker electronically 9/7.
on Count 3.
STC canceled; awaiting filing of DPA and addressing issue of community service hours.
from defendant.  Copy sent to DA's office.
Left message of rescheduled STC in defendant's voice mail at phone number provided by PD's office this date.
Status conference on August 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on July 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Plead no contest to obstruction- Count 1,  Possession of  drug para. Count 2 and Count 3.  Count 3 will have a 3 year DPA.   Court recited the charge and the possible penalties.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated as to a factual basis for the charges.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty Counts 1 and 2.  Finding withheld on Count 3.  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation.   Perform 120 hours of community service within the 1st 6 months of probation.  Seek and maintain employment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   CC .  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation. Counts 1 and 2.  Perform 120 hours of community service within the first 6 months of probation.  Seek and maintain employment. Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   Court costs, including DNA surcharge.  No sample required.  May apply for expungement at age 21 if he successfully completes probation and the DPA.  Diversion agreement approved for count 3.  To be filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-05-2015 01:30 pm
Information filed with the Court.  Schedule arraignment, plea and sentencing.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and wiht Attorney Poss.  Form filed with court.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  Defendant understands waiver.  Court finds that the defendatn has voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived his right to prellimiary hearing.  Probable cause found.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Deputy M.B. to appear at 9/1/15 preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing at 09-01-2015 11:00 am

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Carly Sebion.  This is Attorney Poss' case, and he has been working on it.  Court allows 1 more STC, set for 7/20/15 at 3 pm

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Counsel indicate to the Court that there is a DPA on the table but they need more discussion.  Set for status 6-29-15 at 3:00.
Status conference at 06-08-2015 03:00 pm

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Dfendant appeared in person, and with Attorney Poss.  Reading of complaint waived.  Time limits for PH waived.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Defendant said he understood waiver.  Court finds defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found.  Court ordered defendant to go to the sheriff's dept. to submit DNA sample.  PTC & STC dates set.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Michael Schehr; Samuel Arlozynski; Nathan Mallon; and Kyle Ingram.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Court explained the charges and possible penalties to defendant.  Defendant said he would probably hire his own attorney.  Bond set.  AIA set for 4/6/15.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Michael Schehr; Samuel Arlozynski; Nathan Mallon; and Kyle Ingram.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
